AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the white Malibu sedan: Vehicle observed by Agent Jorge Luis Trevino with five passengers, designed to hold that many people, and appeared to be riding low. It was a rental vehicle registered to Hertz Rental Car Company, rented at the Laredo International Airport. The passengers were stiff and not communicating with each other. RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. claimed it did not go off the road during the incident.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the United States Border Patrol radio: Radio used by United States Border Patrol agents for communication and coordination regarding traffic stops, arrests, and lookout alerts for suspicious vehicles. Used to inform about the stop of a white Malibu sedan with five or six illegal aliens.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the black Dodge pickup truck: Vehicle subject of a BOLO, driven by IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR., and stopped by Officer Reymundo Reyes for a traffic violation. Its ownership was claimed to be IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s aunt's and later his cousin's. Impounded during the incident. Located within fifty miles of the Mexico border. It was registered to Corinth, Texas. Driven on and off the road. Had a camper, either dark blue or black in color.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s white Malibu se: Vehicle stopped by United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge Luis Trevino. It was a rental vehicle registered to Hertz Rental Car Company, rented at the Laredo International Airport. RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. testified that he did not go off the road during the incident.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the United States Border Patrol vehicle: Vehicle used by United States Border Patrol agents for patrol and surveillance.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the computer: Computer used by Officer Reymundo Reyes to conduct a check during the traffic stop. Also used in routine traffic stops to run checks on driver's licenses, insurance papers, and vehicle registrations. Utilized to verify information before receiving consent to search the black Dodge pickup truck.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s white Malibu se: Vehicles driving in tandem, with the white Malibu sedan containing contraband, providing probable cause for arresting the driver of the other vehicle. They exited off U.S. Highway 59 to the right and turned southbound onto Farm-to-Market Road 2050.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.a pager: Possessed by the defendant, used for communication in addition to a cellular phone, indicating involvement in smuggling activities.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.a cellular phone: Possessed by the defendant, used for communication in addition to a pager, indicating involvement in smuggling activities.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.rental cars: Vehicles frequently used by smugglers to transport illegal aliens, as they can be easily rented and returned without significant loss if caught. Often used to avoid losing personal vehicles in case of being caught or busted.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.a phone call: Received by Marco Montemayor regarding an attempted alien smuggling event.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.his citation: Citation given to IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. after being stopped by Officer Reymundo Reyes.
